home.heroDescription: A farm-to-table restaurant in Bordeaux, where we cook with products from neighboring organic farms. The best of local terroir, strong connections, a cuisine that respects what matters.

values.title: A cuisine with
values.description1: The message is simple: defend the terroir at all costs, respect living things and source exclusively from local producers and artisans.
values.description2: Because it's possible to offer delicious cuisine that's also ultra-local.

card1.title: Zero compromise
card1.description: Raw products grown using organic farming, peasant methods, respecting living soil, without pesticides…

card2.title: Direct from Producers
card2.description: Neighboring farms that deliver directly to us, from 20km to 150km at most. That's real taste: fresh, simple, immediate.

card3.title: Les Récoltants Farm
card3.description: We grow our vegetables using organic farming, in our own field 20km from here. Nothing truer, nothing simpler.

card4.title: Fairness
card4.description: A fair price for the producer, an honest price for you, and dignified conditions for the whole team. Fairness at every level.

ecosystem.description1: At Les Récoltants, everything is based on a virtuous circle that connects the farm, the kitchen and the land.
ecosystem.description2: Our vegetables grow in living soils, just a stone's throw away. We cook them in their entirety, without waste. And what's left goes back to nourish the soil through our compost.
ecosystem.description3: From field to plate, then from plate to earth: this is our way of caring for taste, producers and the territory.

hero.title: The
hero.description:
20km from Bordeaux, the organic garden of Les Récoltants. Where vegetables patiently wait for the perfect moment for their harvest.

From the gardener's hand to the chef's, we create the menu that highlights the flavors of nature.

story.mainTitle: Our farm is located on a rich clay terroir that gives all its strength to our vegetables.

section1.title: At the farm
section1.intro: Our practices are inspired by agroecology and respect for living things.
section1.description: François, a peasant market gardener, works with nature, not against it: living soils, crop rotations, peasant seeds, preservation of biodiversity... Every gesture aims to nourish the earth as much as our plates, for sustainable agriculture deeply respectful of living things.

section2.title: The terroir
section2.intro: Here, the soil is clay-loam. It naturally retains water and preserves minerals.
section2.description: This terroir, generous by nature, better resists droughts and fully supports our approach: cultivating in a 100% natural way, respecting the soils and working with what they have most precious.

section3.title: The vegetables
section3.intro: About sixty varieties are grown throughout the year, favoring heirloom varieties.
section3.description: This natural diversity allows us to preserve authentic and rich flavors, far from standardized norms.

producers.title: Valuing the work of producers
producers.relationDescription: We maintain a direct and close relationship with all the producers and artisans we work with: we know them personally, exchange with them every week, understand their farming practices and put their know-how at the heart of our cuisine.

pillar1.title: Fair compensation
pillar1.description: It is essential for us that the producers we work with are fairly and sustainably compensated. We ensure that the price of products is balanced and consistent for everyone: producers, customers and restaurant.
points: Prices set in consultation with the producer
pillar1.label: Fair price

pillar2.title: Peasant & local farming
pillar2.description: We defend a demanding vision of agriculture, peasant, local and human, respectful of the environment, of life and traditional know-how.

pillar3.title: Heritage breeds & varieties
pillar3.description: Limousin cows, Gascon pigs, Pyrenean goats... We work for the promotion of local animal breeds and heirloom varieties threatened by standardization.

hero.title: A cuisine that celebrates the
hero.description: Our menu evolves with the rhythm of harvests and seasons. Each dish highlights a producer, a craft, a story.

philosophy.title: On the
philosophy.paragraph1: At Les Récoltants, we chose not to freeze our menu. The heart of our project is to adapt to harvests, season after season, and to products available at the moment from our partner producers and in our fields. Every day, our entirely homemade cuisine reinvents itself based on arrivals, to offer a fresh, living, and sincere menu.
philosophy.paragraph2: Our cuisine defends local peasant farming. Simple and sincere but not simplistic, it is guided by the quality of the products we work with. Here, everything is local, with no intermediaries between your plate and the field.
philosophy.quote: From field to plate, no detours

gallery.quote: Each dish tells the story of a producer, a terroir, a season
